intro: Xiphidium albidum, commonly known as the white thornapple, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces showy, yellowish-white flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, and the plant is often found in dry, open habitats. Due to its toxic properties, it is important to handle it with care.
